722626f-a.text:
Pleasant Ave., east side, north fro and including East 114th to and including 115th Streets. This, the Standard Gas Light Co. Plant, will
be completeydemolished.
September 12, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

722628f-a.text:
(1)
A rear view of Pleasant Ave., east side, from, but not including East 114th to and including 115th Streets. The view shows a portion of the site of the Standard Gas Light Co., Plant, during demolition. Gas tanks shown, are on the S.E. corner of East 115th Street.
September 12, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
The same, from a different angle. Notice the spire of the Church oof Our Lady of Mt. Carmel, (on East 115th Street, west of Pleasant Ave),
through the structural frame of gas tanks.
November 9, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

722628f-b.text:
(1)
A rear view of Pleasant Ave., east side, from, but not including East 114th to and including 115th Streets. The view shows a portion of the site of the Standard Gas Light Co., Plant, during demolition. Gas tanks shown, are on the S.E. corner of East 115th Street.

P. L. Sperr.
(2)

through the structural frame of gas tanks.
November 9, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

722629f-b.text:
Pleasant Aoenue, east side, between East 114th and 116th Streets, showing the new site for the Benjamin Franklin High School under preparation. This S3,500,000 structure is to seat 3285 students. It will be erected in the form of a double E and front onto the East River Drive. A fuller account of the various details and an architects sketch will be found in the Ney York
Times of November 22, 1939.
Individually the photographer gives the locations as, northward from the new East River Drive and 114th Street in No. 1: a demolition at Pleasant Avenue and 115th Street in No. 2; and another demolition at the S. E. corner of 116th Street and the Avenue, in
No. 3.
July 16, 1939
Views 1,2,3
P. L. Sperr

715076f-a.text:
East 114th Street, north side, between Pleasant Ave.,and the Harlen River, as seen from across Jefferson Park (foreground) northward. These
buildings will be demolished.
November 9, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

731659f-a.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
731659f-a.text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel, No. 7: Stands and amusement erected for the Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel on East 114th Street, at Pleasant Ave. On the right appears a portion of Jefferson Park.
July 16, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
No. 6:
The same as the preceding view. Note the Triborough Bridge on
Wards Island, in the background.
July 16, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
No. 9:
The same street at First Ave.
July 16, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.

731611f-b.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
731611f-b.text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Vendors of clams, with pushcart set up in Jefferson Park, at 114th Street and Pleasant Avenue. In the background is seen part of the Standard Gas Light plant
which in a few years is to be demolished.
July 16, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Vendors of sacred pictures, rosaries, and other religious trinkets, on Pleasant Avenue; the view is north from 114th
Street.
July 16, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.
(3)
Votive images, dolls and candles on sale, shop near Jeffenson
Park.
July 16, 1926.
P. L. Sperr.
731611f-b.folder: 114th Street and Pleasant Avenue  , Manhattan, N.Y.

731643f-b.title: Feast of Our Lady of Mount Carmel.
731643f-b.text:
(1)
Feast of Our Lady of Mt. Carmel: Pretnels for sale by two enterprising youngsters at the eastern end of 114th Street, east
of Pleasant Avenue.
The sign in the background applies to the ferris wheel, which
is not shown in this view.
July 16, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
Another pretnel vendor, at the S.E. corner of Pleasant Avenue and 114th Street. The view is east. Notice the ferris wheel, operated by the American Legion, in the background.
July 16, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REROUUCTIONS: N8q.ESt 80(7
(3)
Pretnels, on the S.E. corner of First Avenue and 114th Street.
The view is roughly northwest.
July 16. 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
731643f-b.folder: 114th Street and Pleasant Avenue, Manhattan, N.Y.

722630f-a.text:
Pleasant Ave., east side, north from, but not including East 114th to and including 116th Streets. Clearance in the foreground, was formerly the site of the Standard Gas Light Co., Plant.
July 19, 1935.

The same, showing a further view northward.
March 6, 1936.
